title: Code Survival Metric is Not Reported Properly for GPT models

labels.name: telemetry
labels.description: Telemetry system issues

body:
<!-- ⚠️⚠️ Do Not Delete This! bug_report_template ⚠️⚠️ -->
<!-- Please read our Rules of Conduct: https://opensource.microsoft.com/codeofconduct/ -->
<!-- 🕮 Read our guide about submitting issues: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-and-Suggestions -->
<!-- 🔎 Search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- 🧪 Test using the latest Insiders build to see if your issue has already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->
<!-- 💡 Instead of creating your report here, use 'Report Issue' from the 'Help' menu in VS Code to pre-fill useful information. -->
<!-- 🔧 Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes/No

<!-- 🪓 If you answered No above, use 'Help: Start Extension Bisect' from Command Palette to try to identify the cause. -->
<!-- 📣 Issues caused by an extension need to be reported directly to the extension publisher. The 'Help > Report Issue' dialog can assist with this. -->
- VS Code Version: 
- OS Version: 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Query code survival for agent mode by joining agent mode events of '/response*' or 'panel.request' (source of 'chat.editAgent' or command of 'editAgent') and compare request counts with survival metrics by model (from the panel request or chat  response events). Filter for a Properties.requestsource of 'agent' in the survival data
2. Observe that gpt models have much lower survival calculation request counts (almost none) relative to sonnet and other models

A hint to what may be going on after digging a bit and chatting with @isidorn - it looks like gpt models might have a Properties.requestsource of 'api_tool' and 'api_undefined' most of the time. Isidor suggested this might be the reason, that applyPatch uses a different code path and this is what gpt models use to apply edits. 

I did some initial queries on our telemetry not filtering on the requestsource and it gets the counts a little higher for gpt models but not all the way there. I also noticed some more requestids for the survival count recordings that were "undefined" for gpt, so this may also be a part of it.

labels.name: ux
labels.description: User experience issues

body: The vertical indentation lines in tree views have a non-standard placement in relation to the chevrons / twisties: I propose to horizontally align them either centrally or to the left: Personally, I think left aligned is the better approach as it will give file / tree item icons & chevrons more breathing room.

title: Fixes "Caret jumps to column 0 when clicking between first two characters"
body:
Fixes issue https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/263098 that was introduced in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/pull/235174

Problem:
xLeftBoundary is not correctly at where the left most line of the editor content, it is blocking clicking on the first column

Solution:
Remove horizontalScrollPadding from the cursor leaving editor content on the left side check. horizontalScrollPadding should not have been added to the left side check because layoutInfo.contentLeft correctly matches the left most point of the editor content

title: Visual Studio Code cannot run from filesystem which is case-sensitive
body:
Type: Bug Visual Studio Code cannot run from filesystem which is case-sensitive (e.g. SMB which is case-senstive, WinBTRFS, NFS, ms-nfs41-client, ...). Trying to start it from cmd.exe it generates these error messages: # Visual Studio code cannot run from filesystem (N:) which is case-sensitive. It just cannot find it's DLL, because the name of the DLLs uses the wrong case N:\software\Microsoft VS Code>"N:\software\Microsoft VS Code\Code.exe" N:\software\Microsoft VS Code> Unable to create argv.json configuration file in C:\Users\roland_mainz\.vscode\argv.json, falling back to defaults (Error: EPERM: operation not permitted, mkdir 'C:\Users\roland_mainz\.vscode') [7024:0904/131453.184:ERROR:content\browser\gpu\gpu_process_host.cc:951] GPU process launch failed: error_code=18 [7024:0904/131453.340:ERROR:content\browser\gpu\gpu_process_host.cc:951] GPU process launch failed: error_code=18 [7024:0904/131453.371:ERROR:content\browser\gpu\gpu_process_host.cc:951] GPU process launch failed: error_code=18 [7024:0904/131453.403:ERROR:content\browser\gpu\gpu_process_host.cc:951] GPU process launch failed: error_code=18 [7024:0904/131453.403:ERROR:content\browser\gpu\gpu_process_host.cc:951] GPU process launch failed: error_code=18 [7024:0904/131453.746:ERROR:content\browser\gpu\gpu_process_host.cc:951] GPU process launch failed: error_code=18 [7024:0904/131453.778:ERROR:content\browser\gpu\gpu_process_host.cc:951] GPU process launch failed: error_code=18 [7024:0904/131453.793:ERROR:content\browser\gpu\gpu_process_host.cc:951] GPU process launch failed: error_code=18 [7024:0904/131453.809:ERROR:content\browser\gpu\gpu_process_host.cc:951] GPU process launch failed: error_code=18 [7024:0904/131453.809:FATAL:content\browser\gpu\gpu_data_manager_impl_private.cc:415] GPU process isn't usable. title: Blocked vscode-webview request vscode-webview://xxxx
body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes(In addition to Github Copilot, because I need an AI conversation carrier) - VS Code Version: 1.103.0 - OS Version: Linux x64 6.8.0-65-generic I encountered a problem when using the chat-output-renderer-sample to experience the proposed API `chatOutputRenderer`. I have a mermaid image generated when I have a continuous conversation in the same session window. When I scroll up with the mouse to view the history of the conversation, the mermaid image disappears. And 100% reproducibility. Steps to Reproduce: 1. Use the sample provided by @mjbvz to pull dependencies and compile into a vsix package. 2. Install it using VSCode and run it using the following command. `./code --enable-proposed-api chat-output-renderer-sample` 3. Have at least two conversations, making sure to call the `#createMermaidDiagram` tool each time to generate a mermaid diagram. 4. Slide the mouse wheel up, and then the problem occurs. The mermaid images in the webview returned before are gone, like: ### More Information: Every time the problem recurs, an error will appear in the log > [error] Blocked vscode-webview request vscode-webview://0r2vgj108bhq26crammch3n2hlbi9ke4ks41cd9p2q9nbqi70o2g/index.html?id=63efc22f-8e96-4644-a5c4-8f07974bf63b&parentId=1&origin=2a87478f-ddec-4010-b717-019cefe21f38&swVersion=4&extensionId=xiaomi.chat-output-renderer-sample&platform=electron&vscode-resource-base-authority=vscode-resource.vscode-cdn.net&parentOrigin=vscode-file%3A%2F%2Fvscode-app&purpose=chatOutputItem I think `chatOutputRenderer` is a great feature and I hope to do more with it, so please help me figure out where the problem lies. Thanks!

title: "if" keyword syntax highlighting breaks with #if + single-line comment on previous line in C (not C++)
body: Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: **Yes** - VS Code Version: 1.103.2 (user setup) - OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.26100 --- This is not a [C/C++ for Visual Studio Code](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-vscode.cpptools) issue. It happens regardless of the extension being enabled or disabled. Here is what correct C syntax highlighting looks like. Note the pink `if` keywords: Here is what happens if you add a single-line comment on the same line as the `#if` preprocessor directive. Note how the `if` statement on the following line (`779`) now has the wrong color: Curiously, this seems to only happen with the `#if` preprocessor directive. If I use a different preprocessor directive, the issue disappears: The issue also only happens with single-line comments (`// `). It doesn't happen with block comments (`/* */`): And here is a screenshot with all extensions disabled (`code --disable-extensions`): Curiously, this issue only happens in the C language, but doesn't happen with C++ cpp files: --- Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create an empty `*.c` file and paste this code in: ```c int main() { #if 1 // this line comment breaks the following `if` if (1) // this line has wrong syntax highlighting { } #endif if (1) // this line is correct { } } ``` 2. If statement on line `4` will be incorrectly shown a different color from if statement on line `9` or you can also just paste this minimal example anywhere in your project: ```c #if 1 // foo if(1) { } #endif ``` --- Seems like any preprocessor directive containing "if" will cause this issue (like `#ifndef` in the following example), maybe because of some wrong regex or newline handling?

title: Fix stdin pipe file position issue
body:
Fix #260309 that file position become inconsistent when using stdin redirection.

Fix this by replacing stdin redirection symbol directly with tmp pipe file, instead of filtering first, adding then. (I'm new to open source contribution, so I hope I could fix the "good first issue" for the community!)

body:
We introduce a setting to hide all AI this milestone: https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/249615

Our existing action for hiding AI features should help the user learn this setting, as such we propose to:
* update its behaviour to open the settings editor and reveal the setting for the user to click it
* rename the action to "Learn How to Hide AI Features"

//cc @isidorn

title: Update Objective-C syntax hightlighting to support missing opaque types

title: Prefix `SIMULATION` environment variable

labels.name: debt
labels.description: Code quality issues

body:
@bhavyaus it is not a good idea to use such a generic name like `SIMULATION`, at the very minimum you need to prefix with `VSCODE_` as we do with other environment variables.

_Originally posted by @bpasero in https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/265050#issuecomment-3252047042_

title: Chat sessions view tree should adhere to focus standards when opening editors
body:
Today clicking a session moves focus into the editor, which breaks accessibility.

You should be passing on the options in the `open` event from the tree/list to control this accordingly, e.g.:

https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/8bdbcf0e32b1b6e4b328dd86656279860f24123a/src/vs/workbench/contrib/files/browser/views/explorerView.ts#L517

In a nutshell, the tree knows how an item was selected (mouse, keyboard, etc) and then can tell you if:
* focus should be preserved or not
* the editor should be pinned or not

title: Cannot submit Copilot Chat messages after symlinking AGENTS.md to .github/copilot-instructions.md

labels.name: insiders-released
labels.description: Patch has been released in VS Code Insiders

body:
### Environment
- **Copilot Chat extension version**: 0.30.3
- **Visual Studio Code version**: 1.103.2
- **Operating System**: macOS 15.4.1 (24E263)
- **Copilot model(s)**: all
- **Repository change**: Renamed `.github/copilot-instructions.md` to `AGENTS.md`, then created a symlink:
```
ln -s AGENTS.md .github/copilot-instructions.md
```


### Steps to Reproduce
1. Rename `.github/copilot-instructions.md` to `AGENTS.md`.
2. Create a symlink: `ln -s AGENTS.md .github/copilot-instructions.md`.
3. Reload VS Code or reopen the repository.
4. Open the Copilot Chat interface.
5. Attempt to send a chat message.

### Expected Behavior
Messages in Copilot Chat should send normally, with responses incorporating the repository’s custom instructions.

### Actual Behavior
After introducing the symlink, the chat input becomes unresponsive — messages cannot be sent.
